title: 110_hr7074
content: The Act titled "Home Office Tax Deduction Simplification and Improvement Act of 2008" provides for an optional standard home office deduction. The Act "Home Office Tax Deduction Simplification and Improvement Act of 2008" allows individuals to elect a standard home office deduction in lieu of other limitations for business use of a dwelling unit. The Act "Home Office Tax Deduction Simplification and Improvement Act of 2008" allows individuals to elect a standard home office deduction instead of other limitations for business use of a dwelling unit. The standard home office deduction is calculated based on the applicable home office standard rate and the square footage of the relevant portion of the dwelling unit. The applicable home office standard rate is determined by the Secretary for different categories of businesses. The maximum square footage allowed for deduction is also determined annually for each category of business. The taxpayer can make an election under this paragraph for a dwelling unit, which will apply for each succeeding taxable year unless revoked. Revocation is allowed once per dwelling unit, but after revoking, the taxpayer cannot elect this paragraph again for that unit. The taxpayer can elect this paragraph for a dwelling unit, which will apply for each succeeding taxable year unless revoked. No other deduction or credit shall be allowed for the taxable year for any amount attributable to the portion of a dwelling unit taken into account under this paragraph, except for disaster losses. The taxpayer can elect to take a disaster loss into account as a loss under section 165 for the applicable taxable year, in addition to the standard home office deduction. The Secretary will prescribe necessary regulations. The modification of home office business use rules includes using the place of business for meeting or dealing with patients or clients. The taxpayer can elect to take a disaster loss into account as a loss under section 165 for the applicable taxable year, in addition to the standard home office deduction. The modification of home office business use rules includes using the place of business for meeting or dealing with patients, clients, or customers in the normal course of the taxpayer's trade or business. The de minimis personal use provision is also amended to allow for non-business activities in a portion of a dwelling unit used exclusively for business. The Secretary of the Treasury is required to ensure that all forms and schedules used to calculate or report itemized deductions and profits or losses are updated within 60 days of the enactment of this Act. The amendments made by this section relate to calculating itemized deductions and profits or losses for real estate taxes, mortgage interest, and depreciation under specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2008.
